com.facebook.buck.parser

Class BuildTargetPatternParser<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.buck.parser.BuildTargetPatternParser<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BuildTargetPatternTargetNodeParser

    @Immutable
public abstract class BuildTargetPatternParser<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Context for parsing build target names. Fully-qualified target names are parsed the same regardless of the context.

    • Constructor Summary

      • parse

        public final T parse(Function<Optional<java.lang.String>,java.nio.file.Path> cellNames,
      java.lang.String buildTargetPattern)
        1. //src/com/facebook/buck/cli:cli will be converted to a single build target 2. //src/com/facebook/buck/cli: will match all in the same directory. 3. //src/com/facebook/buck/cli/... will match all in or under that directory. For case 2 and 3, parseContext is expected to be forVisibilityArgument().

      • forBaseName

        public static BuildTargetPatternParser<BuildTargetPattern> forBaseName(java.lang.String baseName)
        Used when parsing target names relative to another target, such as in a build file.
        Parameters:
        baseName - name such as //first-party/orca

      • forVisibilityArgument

        public static BuildTargetPatternParser<BuildTargetPattern> forVisibilityArgument()
        Used when parsing target names in the visibility argument to a build rule.

      • fullyQualified

        public static BuildTargetPatternParser<BuildTargetPattern> fullyQualified()
        Used when parsing fully-qualified target names only, such as from the command line.

      • makeTargetDescription

        public abstract java.lang.String makeTargetDescription(java.lang.String buildTargetName,
                                     java.lang.String buildFileName)
        Returns:
        description of the target name and context being parsed when an error was encountered. Examples are ":azzetz in build file //first-party/orca/orcaapp/BUCK" and "//first-party/orca/orcaapp:mezzenger in context FULLY_QUALIFIED"
